content.webTitle: CD: Stokowski: Symphonic Transcriptions, Bournemouth SO/ Serebrier

fields.headline: Stokowski: Symphonic Transcriptions, Bournemouth SO/ Serebrier
fields.bodyText: Though a couple of short Tchaikovsky arrangements are included too, it's Leopold Stokowski's reworkings of Mussorgsky that dominate this disc. There is the version of Night on Bare Mountain the conductor made for Walt Disney's Fantasia, as well as the Entr'acte to the fourth act of Khovanshchina, the "symphonic synthesis" concocted from Boris Godunov and his vivid orchestration of Pictures at an Exhibition. All those pieces are also included on Oliver Knussen's Stokowski/Mussorgsky disc with the Cleveland Orchestra for Deutsche Grammophon, and this really is the kind of spectacular orchestral writing that repays the kind of top-notch playing that is the Cleveland's stock-in-trade. Good though they are, the Bournemouth Symphony hasn't got the same tonal resources; though the results they produce for José Serebrier are decent, they lack the spine-tingling presence.
